result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry D Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: time currently being served

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment, and after care as well as domestic violence counseling, cognitive intervention, and psychological evaluation. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must be compliant with any child support, child visitation, and/or paternity orders. No contact with victim until domestic violence counseling is complete and then only if contact is approved by victim and agent. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless one has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: time currently being served

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Larry D Beck in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Larry D Beck in custody and was not produced.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for Rebecca Sommers for the State of Wisconsin.
Ms. Tanck-Adams indicates that Ms. Sommers will be ready. There is one discovery issue that Ms. Popken has emailed the State about numerous times.  Defense MIL will be granted. State MIL will be granted. State MIL's will be granted. There are no Daubert issues, no crime lab issues and all witnesses are available for both sides. Anticipated length of trial is 2 days. There will be 1 alternate, 5 strikes each side.  The Court will give the following preliminary instructions: 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101.

BTC: The Court notes that it is the rule of this Court that the parties who are going to try the case MUST be present at the final pretrial. The report that the Defense is missing must be turned over to her by 5:00 pm Monday 11/23. Counsel is urged to review any prior records of witnesses prior to trial. Trial remains.

Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, AMS and EDN  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
